task_summary: Approach the fridge, grasp the handle, pull to open the hinged door, verify it is open, and retreat safely.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 manipulator opens a compact refrigerator in a cluttered lab corner. The arm must find the handle, align precisely, grasp, and pull the hinged door to swing it open. The contact sheet shows progression from approach to a fully opened door and postâ€‘action retreat. Constraints include limited space beside drawers and the fridge, accurate handle localization, secure grasp stability, and collision avoidance during the door swing arc.
preconditions: Robot base is positioned within reach of the fridge
Gripper operational and free of objects
stepwise_plan: Perceive and localize the fridge handle
Open gripper and align to handle
Verify door is open and clear
Retreat from the door swing path
success_criteria: Door angle visibly increases from closed to open state
No collisions with drawers or surroundings
Arm retreats clear of the open door
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: rescan with raster pattern and adjust approach
Grasp slip: re-open gripper, recompute grasp, and retry
Door jam or obstruction: stop, verify contact forces, and try smaller pulls
Perception noise: revalidate visibility before grasp
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when ContainerOpen confirms the fridge door is open and the arm has retreated the specified distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector is aligned at the handle with impending contact, signaling readiness to grasp.
frame_3.predicts_next: A pull or door-opening actuation should follow immediately once the grasp is secured.

node_specs.description: Position the end-effector near the fridge to start the manipulation.
Verify the arm has reached the fridge-front approach pose.
Search the visual field to locate the fridge handle reliably.
Plan a pull-style grasp for the door handle and store it on the blackboard.
Prepare gripper aperture for engaging the handle.
Move to the planned pregrasp and align within tight tolerance to the handle.
Execute the grasp using the stored handle grasp pose.
Confirm the handle is securely grasped before pulling.
Commanded pull to open the hinged fridge door while holding the handle.
Check that the fridge door is now open.
Back the arm out to a safe distance from the open door.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to glare or occlusion
Door blocked by nearby drawer or objects
Arm path collides with door edge during swing
recovery_strategy: Rescan with raster and vary viewpoint
Re-open gripper, recompute grasp, and retry
Abort pull, inspect for obstruction, then reattempt
Retreat and re-approach with adjusted alignment
assumptions: Frames depict a hinged door opening outward with a pull on the right-side handle
Instruction matches frames; no conflict observed
